item.title: Susanne add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Marriage is a fine institution, but I'm not ready for an institution." -- Mae West

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I used to be Snow White, but I drifted." -- Mae West

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Dawn: When men of reason go to bed." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The ships hung in the sky in much the same way that bricks don't." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Gene Fowler
item.description: "Writing is easy. You only need to stare at a blank piece of paper until drops of blood form on your forehead." -- Gene Fowler

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "Easy reading is damn hard writing." -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Phil Ford
item.description: "The philosopher Sir James Mackintosh had said that the powers of a man's mind were proportionate to the quantity of coffee he drank, and Voltaire had knocked back fifty cups of it a day, so Ianto reckoned there had to be something in it. And saving Cardiff from the kinds of things that came through the Rift called for quick, inspired thinking, so Ianto took it upon himself to make sure the coffee was good. Ianto Jones, saving the world with a dark roast." -- Phil Ford

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Hope is the thing with feathers That perches in the soul And sings the tune without the words And never stops at all." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Nature is a haunted house--but Art--is a house that tries to be haunted." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Because I could not stop for Death – He kindly stopped for me – The Carriage held but just Ourselves – And Immortality." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Two roads diverged in a wood, and I took the road less traveled by and they CANCELLED MY FRIKKIN' SHOW. I totally shoulda took the road that had all those people on it. Damn." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "There's a time and place for everything, and I believe it’s called 'fan fiction'." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Jim Thompson
item.description: "A weed is a plant out of place." -- Jim Thompson

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Sir James Mackintosh
item.description: "The powers of a man's mind are directly proportioned to the quantity of coffee he drinks." -- Sir James Mackintosh

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Linda Grayson
item.description: "There is nothing better than a friend, unless it is a friend with chocolate." -- Linda Grayson

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Michael Crichton
item.description: "If you don't know history, then you don't know anything. You are a leaf that doesn't know it is part of a tree. " -- Michael Crichton

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Chris Avellone
item.description: "You are wrong. If there is anything I have learned in my travels across the Planes, it is that many things may change the nature of a man. Whether regret, or love, or revenge or fear - whatever you believe can change the nature of a man, can. I've seen belief move cities, make men stave off death, and turn an evil hag's heart half-circle. This entire Fortress has been constructed from belief. Belief damned a woman, whose heart clung to the hope that another loved her when he did not. Once, it made a man seek immortality and achieve it. And it has made a posturing spirit think it is something more than a part of me." -- Chris Avellone

item.title: Susanne add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Nerd girls are the world’s most underutilized romantic resource. And guys, do not tell me that nerd girls are not hot because that shows a Paris Hilton-esque failure to understand hotness." -- John Green

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Howard Koch
item.description: "We'll always have Paris." -- Howard Koch

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Ian Fleming
item.description: "Mr Bond, they have a saying in Chicago: 'Once is happenstance. Twice is coincidence. The third time it's enemy action'." -- Ian Fleming

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Ian Fleming
item.description: "I would stay away from him and leave him to go his own road where there would be other women, countless other women, who would probably give him as much physical pleasure as he had had with me. I wouldn’t care, or at least I told myself that I wouldn’t care, because none of them would ever own him—own any larger piece of him than I now did." -- Ian Fleming

item.title: Susanne add a quote by John Scalzi
item.description: "I'll say it: I want to see an ugly woman as a spokeswoman for a women's network. Ugly men are out there all the time – look at Larry King, for God's sake. He looks like someone's talking underwear. Why not give America a spokeswoman who ain't much to look at but is competent as Hell? If accomplishments actually count for women, this ought to be a no-brainer." -- John Scalzi

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Man is condemned to be free; because once thrown into the world, he is responsible for everything he does. It is up to you to give [life] a meaning." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Hell is—other people!" -- Jean-Paul Sartre
